TMS API

Table Management System

See: Description

Packages 
Package Description
org.tms.api
TMS is a framework for ad-hoc analysis of complex data.
org.tms.api.derivables
Derivables are TableElements that can be assigned formulas (derivations).
org.tms.api.events
The TMS event subsystem.
org.tms.api.exceptions
Static factory classes to construct Table and TableContext objects.
org.tms.api.factories
Exceptions thrown by TMS events.
org.tms.api.io
Options to import and export Tables to a variety of formats.
org.tms.api.utils  

Table Management System

TMS, the Table Management System, is a framework for ad hoc analysis of complex data. Developed in Java, its special ability is that it allows users to defined derived columns, derived rows, and derived cells, to perform ad hoc data analyses. TMS provides a rich language of over 250 functions (see below), as well as allows developers to develop their own functions to operate on standard or custom data types (classes) from within the framework. TMS allows Java developers to easily incorporate spreadsheet-like analytics capability into web and applet applications.

The TMS data structures are performant, and the project uses test-driven development to provide quality and code coverage. A rich API is provided that allows developers to easily and quickly integrate TMS into their applications. Full Javadoc and source are provided.

See the TMS Wiki at http://github.com/cdswindell/tms/wiki for complete details and to learn how to become involved.
